articles.title: Explained: Study links South Asian descent gene to higher Covid risk; here are the key findings - The Indian Express
articles.description: The gene is possibly just one factor that could have led to these outcomes, since socio-economic factors also partly explain why some communities were more severely impacted by the disease.
articles.content: This gene called LZTFL1  can be found in 60 percent of people with South Asian ancestry and the researchers say that it may be able to explain the excess deaths seen in some of the UK communities and… [+2154 chars]

articles.title: Singapore reports 1767 new Covid-19 cases, likely due to fewer swabs over Deepavali - The Star Online
articles.description: SINGAPORE (The Straits Times/Asia News Network): There were 1,767 new Covid-19 infections reported on Friday (Nov 5), a significant fall from the 3,003 cases a day earlier.

articles.title: Sabre-toothed cats cared for each other when injured, fossil evidence suggests - CBC.ca
articles.description: Researchers identified bone damage suggesting a cat lived a long life with hip dysplasia, which means it likely only could have survived with help from other animals.
articles.content: Scientists have found that the fossilized remains of an adult sabre-toothed cat show signs that it lived with a congenital hip condition, suggesting that it lived in a social group with other cats wh… [+4474 chars]

articles.author: AFP
articles.title: Vietnam gets angry over minister's gold-leaf Salt Bae steak - New Straits Times Online
articles.description: LONDON: A video showing a powerful Vietnamese official enjoying a bite of steak smothered in gold leaf at a luxury London restaurant has sparked online anger in the Southeast Asian country, where the average person earns a few dollars a day.
